website_summaries.verdict: Not fancy, but functional and approximately half the price of other book end sets with similar features and capabilities.
pros: Though inexpensive, these bookends are fairly stable, have protective, padded bottoms, and are capable of holding most types of books
cons: May slip a bit if books aren't stacked tightly

customer_reviews.title: Well worth looking at
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about bookends? The color is fine (they are in a cabinet so who cares). There are three reasons why you should buy these guys instead of some of the alternative offerings: 1. They are an L shape instead of an inverted T. As a result they don't interfere with other objects on the shelf 2. They are tall enough to get the job done without being too tall to fit on a shelf dedicated to paperbacks. 3. They are inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene Gitomer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy like library bookends
customer_reviews.text: I used to work in a library, so I bought these because I had some big books at home that i wanted to organize and they reminded me of the sturdy library bookends we used. I was not disappointed. These are great and don't require a book shelf, just a flat surface. I used them to prop up books on a section of my desk. They keep the books steadfast in place with no other ledges available as extra support.
customer_reviews.author: Coco

customer_reviews.title: Looks great 👍
customer_reviews.text: I love these. The hold up my books that tend to fall over. I’m not a fan of having too many decorativo al bookends so I really like how these hide behind the sleeve of the books to make it invisible and look like it’s freestanding. Super happy with this product! I have 4 on my shelf and bet you can’t even tell where the bookends are on my shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Good, Unobtrusive Bookends
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I needed some new bookends for the top of a bookcase. They work well to brace up a stack of books and the material on the bottom provides grip so that they don’t slide off. Being right-angled in shape, they don’t have a tab or edge to hang off and so work well to create a flush edge with the end of a shelf. They’re also slim and not too tall, so they can fit in narrow spaces or be used hold Blu-ray cases without standing up too tall. The metal appears durable without being too heavy, so they should be easy to use for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: RDDTop Contributor: Batman

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I have an Ikea bookcase with glass shelves, and these work perfectly to hold things in place where others that are smaller and don't have pads sail off the shelves the instant I knock into it (which occurs about 24 times a day). The black is decidedly utilitarian in look and feel, no getting around that. Flip side, I can't see myself paying extra for unicorns or for something in the shape of an anchor. Seriously, I'm definitely getting at least one other set. I doubt you'll find anything better within the same price range.
customer_reviews.author: area manTop Contributor: Health & Wellness

customer_reviews.title: Get them! Shelf space savers.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a white pair of these for my bookshelf, and my husband liked them so much, he immediately got on Amazon and ordered 2 black pairs for his bookshelf. These little guys are tough! They do the trick of holding up your books and adding even more space to your shelves with their simple design. Our other fancier bookends were just taking up too much space on our shelves, and we wanted more room for our books. These will help with that! Strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Evangeline

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: These are really sturdy. I wanted to hold my cookbooks up without having to use a bulky bookend. I just placed the bookends inside the books on the end, so I can’t even see the bookend, which is exactly what I wanted. As I said, I used these bookends to hold up cookbooks. I have 5 big, heavy books and 7 smaller, lighter books. It holds them up fine and has never caused any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Good height for large books
customer_reviews.text: Bookends are tall enough to hold large books but not for large numbers (a 30 inch space). I had to buy a second pair to prevent tipping.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: These bookends are great. Not only are they cheap, but they're also incredibly useful. I love the material, love how it has a soft fabric underneath so it doesn't hurt the furniture, and they're also light yet they definitely work to sustain my books.
customer_reviews.author: valreads

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, just do it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed simple metal bookends for counter top display of cook books and that's what I got. The price was right and they serve their purpose as needed.

customer_reviews.title: What’s to be disappointed by?
customer_reviews.text: They’re bookends! They do everything they are made to do! Hard to be disappointed by a piece of metal that holds books upright.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with the strength of the items. I used them to keep record albums upt=right, and they more then met my expectations. Outstanding!

customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy and worth the money I spent. My bookcase has open ends and work very well to keep books straight.

customer_reviews.title: Practical & Functional
customer_reviews.text: Not the most beautiful bookends you could get, but the most practical! We have about 10 sets of these, & we will definitely be ordering more in the future. Love that it has the padding (non-slip base) on the bottom, which keeps it steady as you organize your books on the shelf. Highly recommend.
